results.title: Three views from an ivory tower
results.creator_credit: University of California. Dept. of Theatre Arts. Motion Picture Division
results.brief_description: A lesser stone-poet; a scientific builder and the inventor of the ultimate weapon. Each in their own ivory tower thinks they have created their own ideal, and the others had nothing to do with “true creativity” - but they did! Music by Gerrit Bratt. Animation Workshop 1963.

results.title: Three track
results.creator_credit: Beryl Fox, Don Hopkins, Intercom Films and Gilbert Taylor
results.brief_description: Looks at a ski school for pupils with physical disabilities. These ski devotees are coached by dedicated volunteer instructors from the Canadian Ski Alliance. They have worked together to accomplish what for some might seem an impossible task: to master the sport of skiing.

results.title: Three steps to start
results.creator_credit: Julien Bryan, International Film Foundation, Robert Betts and Francis Thompson
results.brief_description: Youthful vandalism prompts a small group of parents to call a meeting and to talk to city and school officials. They learn that there is no single answer to the problem; that there are many factors - home conditions, unemployment, lack of recreational facilities. One section of the town develops a young people’s centre which brings about community development of unified program.

results.title: Three shorts on architecture
results.creator_credit: New Zealand National Film Unit, Sam Neill and David H. Fowler
results.brief_description: 1. “Some Elements of Architecture.” A no-commentary interlude of stone, wood and brick; patterns and colours, enclosed spaces, and people. 2. “Ways of Looking at Buildings.” Comments from assorted people upon high-rise and other buildings, old and new. 3. “Anxiety and Alternative.” Suggestions for new ways of preserving the uniqueness of our place, while building for our future. A comprehensive examination of New Zealand architecture - past, present and possible future.

results.title: Three score years and ten
results.creator_credit: Pauline Shaw and Granada Television International
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Facts Are These”
Looks at some of the positive aspects of old age, and what can be done by the ag ed, their families, and society at large, to make the final years pleasant and contented ones. Intended for children aged 13-16 years.

results.title: Three roads to tomorrow
results.creator_credit: Alan Orbiston, Greenpark Productions and Humphrey Swingler
results.brief_description: A story of the journey of three Nigerian students between their homes and Ibadan University. The three boys live far apart in the three regions of this vast country. The film is designed to show what Nigeria is like today and to illustrate the help which oil power (BP) is giving to the development of the country and its standard of living.

results.title: Three rivers
results.creator_credit: Tom Radford, ONF | NFB, Prairie Productions and Harold Tichenor
results.brief_description: Some forty farmers of the Three Rivers valley in Alberta are opposed to the construction of a dam that will flood their land to provide irrigation for some eight thousand farmers further downstream. They say that a straight cost-benefit argument will cause great injustice, and that building a dam at the proposed site may not, in fact, solve the problem. The farmers maintain that water wastage through badly maintained canals, mismanagement of the watershed and other faults should be dealt with before envisaging construction of a whole new irrigation system.

results.title: Three pirates bold
results.creator_credit: Victor Kayfetz, George K. Arthur, Go Pictures and Ilya Tolston
results.brief_description: On the advice of an old sail maker two boys and a dog hunt for treasure on an island in the Bahamas. Discouraged after strenuous but unfruitful digging, they dive for crayfish which they then sell to a local crayfish dealer.
